content.description: WELCOME TO

section.title: BRETON
section.description:
For almost six decades, Breton has been driven by the purpose of materializing dreams. We were born with our gaze turned towards authentic Brazilian design and have continued, over the years, celebrating the cultural richness of our country in every curve, texture, and finish. Each piece of furniture we create carries the soul of Brazil: bold, welcoming, diverse, and human.
 
Our commitment goes beyond aesthetics. We believe that design can, and should, be a tool for transformation. That's why we combine artisanal tradition and innovation with environmental responsibility, becoming pioneers in the sector by achieving the carbon-negative company seal. This is how we design the future: with consciousness, beauty, and purpose.

At the heart of everything is the customer. We create personalized furniture and experiences, with a careful curation by a multidisciplinary team dedicated to listening attentively and delivering tailor-made solutions. Each piece offers infinite possibilities for customization in measurements, fabrics, and finishes.

Today, we have 19 stores spread across Brazil, in addition to our international flagship in Dubai — a bridge between Brazilian design and the world. And we continue to grow: by 2026, four more units will reinforce this expansion movement, always with the same commitment to excellence, sustainability, and the appreciation of national identity.
section.subTitle: O U R  E S S E N C E

section.title: WHERE WE MATERIALIZE DREAMS
section.subTitle: O U R F A C T O R Y
section.description:
Inaugurated in 2018, our factory in Diadema – São Paulo, was created to offer a complete structure for Breton's production. Led by the brand's board chairman, Marcel Rivkind, the project of approximately 15,000 m² centralizes the brand's manufacturing, logistics, and administrative operations.

Combining artisanal care and high technology, the factory where our products are born is also the place where we reaffirm our commitment to sustainability. The entire project was executed with the aim of mitigating environmental impacts as much as possible and minimizing the waste of materials and raw materials that cannot be reused.

images.description: We combine technology and craftsmanship in a factory committed to sustainability. The project was designed to minimize environmental impacts and waste.

Our team brings together cabinetmakers, carpenters, weavers, and pattern weavers. Through handcrafted care and creativity in every detail, they carry ancestral knowledge passed down through generations, and possess the ability to unite tradition and innovation to create timeless pieces.

We create custom furniture and personalized experiences, with careful curation by a multidisciplinary team dedicated to listening attentively and delivering tailor-made solutions. Each piece offers endless customization possibilities in terms of dimensions, fabrics, and finishes.

section.description: Fostering culture and valuing national creation is in Breton's DNA. That's why, over the years, we have gathered a curation of collaborations that reflect the richness and plurality of Brazil, bringing together renowned names, as well as new talents from different areas of knowledge to develop signature pieces. Each collaboration results in exclusive pieces that celebrate Brazilian identity and translate the innovative essence of our brand.
section.title: BRETON SIGNATURE DESIGN
section.subTitle: O U R P A R T N E R S

images.title: A La Garçonne
images.text: A La Garçonne is led by Alexandre Herchcovitch and Fabio Souza and has reuse as its watchword. Sustainable and inspired by the streetwear scene, the brand reuses fabrics with technology that transition between vintage and contemporary, creating a unique look full of personality, translating this into the collection produced in collab with Breton.

images.title: Ále Alvarenga
images.text: Ále Alvarenga combines creative thinking and his deep industrial knowledge to develop, with sophisticated aesthetics, simple and functional furniture. His inspiration is fueled by tireless research and a keen eye on the market and human behavior.

images.title: André Grippi
images.text: André Grippi believes in design as a tool for expression, for building narratives, and for recording memory. Curious about the different ways in which body and mind dialogue with their surroundings, the designer seeks to relate formal simplicity to matter, in order to propose emotions and questions that awaken the user from everyday inertia.

images.title: Bianca Barbato
images.text: Bianca is a self-taught designer with a focus on furniture design. Her research is constantly refined in different types of raw materials and technologies, ranging from artisanal to industrial, such as laser cutting, molded resin, marquetry, metal casting, among various paths that encompass her creations.

images.title: Bruno Niz
images.text: Bruno Niz began his career in graphic and editorial design, but found his true passion in product and furniture design. His style combines modernism and minimalism, drawing inspiration from various sources ranging from the geometry of graphic design, through architecture, to nature.

images.title: Bruno Simões
images.text: Living in the capital of São Paulo, where he maintains a studio focused on the development of architecture and furniture design projects, Bruno Simões is a curator and develops timeless furniture pieces. With a keen eye, his diverse background – architecture, photography, journalism – is a determining element in his design.

images.title: Brunno Jahara
images.text: Brunno Jahara is a product designer with works presented in various parts of the world. Bringing his cosmopolitan experiences, the cultural pluralism of today's society, and the desire to create designs that express universality without losing a local flavor, Jahara's works follow a marked stylistic line.

images.title: Caio e Carlos Carvalho
images.text: Architects graduated from UFRJ, Carlos Carvalho and Caio Carvalho complemented their studies at Politecnico di Milano. The brothers lead the renowned architecture firm Studio RO+CA, and decided to create their own pieces, as they could not find anything in the furniture market that represented the firm's personality.

images.title: Carol Gay
images.text: An architect by training, Carol has always focused her attention on product design. From an early age, she attended and taught workshops in Brazil and abroad, competed for awards, and was featured in several publications in the segment. Today, she works in her studio in the capital of São Paulo, of which, incidentally, she feels an inseparable part.

images.title: Choque Design
images.text: It is a creative studio that believes there are no borders between architecture, design, and strategic management. The integration of these three areas is the firm's bet. Composed of a multidisciplinary team, CHOQUE invests dedication and great creativity in brand projects, packaging, products, commercial architecture, training, and strategic management.

images.title: Diego Revollo
images.text: An engineer and architect, Diego Revollo values beauty above all in his creations and has aesthetic rigor and the search for balance as his main virtues. With a keen eye and authentic identity, Diego's work is recognized in different areas of expertise, from architecture to design.

images.title: Edu Bortolai
images.text: The designer's contemporary line shows that the culture created by many others can generate a unique design. Edu believes that all aesthetic, technical, and commercial knowledge should be intrinsic to design, and everything that enchants him contributes to his creations. He has won important awards and participated in national and international fairs and exhibitions.

images.title: Estúdio Rain
images.text: Estúdio Rain was created by product designer Mariana Ramos and architect Ricardo Innecco. Their work encompasses a variety of projects. Both were born and studied in Brasília, the country's capital, having experienced a modernist urban and architectural context - references that are reflected in the Studio's vocabulary.

images.title: Faska Rivkind
images.text: Natalie Rivkind and Telma Faska lead the architecture and design firm that bears the last name of the two partners. Architects by training, the talented professionals are inspired by everyday life for the creation of their designs, always taking into account aesthetics, form, functionality, and affectivity.

images.title: Fernanda Marques
images.text: Architecture, interiors, and product design are among the professional's areas of expertise. In all of them, the maintenance of a single style: clean and contemporary, in tune with the best of international art and design. In the last decade alone, the office led by Fernanda has won dozens of awards.

images.title: Fetiche Design
images.text: The Fetiche Design studio was founded by Carolina Armellini and Paulo Biacchi. A fetish is an animated or inanimate object, made by man or produced by nature, to which supernatural power is attributed and worship is paid. This concept is intrinsic to their products: in which the designers seek references and meanings beyond the formal and functional for the pieces.

images.title: Gloria Coelho
images.text: With 48 years of history, the Gloria Coelho fashion brand has dozens of national and international awards. In her creations for furniture design, the brand highlights the main characteristics of the stylist's productions, combining art, design, and technology in minimalist and contemporary pieces.

images.title: Giacomo Tomazzi Studio
images.text: Architect and designer, Diogo Giácomo Tomazzi is inspired by the great masters of Brazilian design and the country's landscapes. With pieces that value functionality, without neglecting the poetry of the design, the designer believes in the fusion between industrial production and artisanal techniques as the foundation for the creation of products with authentic Brazilian essence.

images.title: Karol Suguikawa
images.text: Restless, creative, and proactive, the architect and designer has in her authorial production a look at behavior and the arts, especially neoconcretism. Her visual and affective memories are the fuel for her creations, which are corroborated by behavioral research.

images.title: Lilly Sarti
images.text: The Lilly Sarti brand became known for its popular fashion shows and memorable collections. With a rare concern for a young brand, Lilly and Renata do not neglect details and finishing. The sisters do not limit their themes and research. Their creations are based on films, fashion and art books, and current behavior.

images.title: Linda Martins
images.text: With creations that highlight minimalist elements contrasted with unique details, designer Linda Martins imprints contemporary, playful, and feminine traits on her pieces. Graduated in Interiors, she studied Trends for Professional Designers and specialized in Product Design at Istituto Marangoni, in Milan.

images.title: Luisa Moysés
images.text: Graduated in Industrial Design from FAAP and with a postgraduate degree in furniture design from Elisava university in Barcelona, designer Luisa Moysés is one of the main forces driving Breton's production. Inspired by places where she can connect, she captures details and forms to create authorial pieces with unique and striking identity.

images.title: Murilo Weitz
images.text: Murilo Weitz holds a degree in Architecture and Urbanism from Universidade Mackenzie and in Creation and Fashion Design from University Arts of London. In 2015, he launched his eponymous brand in São Paulo, where he lives and works, and since then, he has dedicated himself to the production of unique or serial objects, within a vast range of interests, from textile design to ceramics.

images.title: Reinaldo Lourenço
images.text: One of Brazil's most renowned stylists, Reinaldo Lourenço has always breathed fashion. He made it a great passion and his greatest personal contribution to making the world more interesting. For the stylist, trend is less important than individuality: "Elegance and power are within each person. You just need to have the attitude to express yourself."

images.title: Suite Design
images.text: Suite Design is focused on surprising and exceeding its clients' expectations. Founded in 2008, in São Paulo, by Carolina Mauro, Daniela Frugiuele, and Filipe Troncon, the professionals combine distinct experiences, technical knowledge, and great creativity to develop modern, sophisticated, and cosmopolitan architecture.

images.title: Tiie Design
images.text: The creative duo Julyana Hilgenstieler and Nicole Liz Salvatierra, leading Tiie Design, create furniture with Brazilian industrial authorship, transmitting artisanal care, even when produced on an industrial scale, and telling childhood stories or recreating everyday pieces with functionality and lightness.

images.title: Victor Vasconcelos
images.text: Victor Vasconcelos argues that his creations should not be restricted only to their formal conjunctions. And precisely by overvaluing the power of forms, his pieces are capable of producing different sensations that vary according to the subjectivity of those who come into contact with them.

section.title: C R E A T E. L I V E. C E L E B R A T E!
section.description:
You are not who you were yesterday, nor who you will be tomorrow.

We are made of changes!

Our experiences.

Our connections.

They are what transform.

Every interaction.

Every challenge.

Every joy lived.

Is what makes us who we are.

And thus, we build who we will be in the future.

Life is about connecting.

With people.

With places.

With moments.

With sensations.

With the past and with the present.

Don't let them go unnoticed.

So, get up. Talk. Laugh.

Live the intensity of every second.

Hug those you love. Gather the family. Walk without a destination. Stroll

with your pet.

Invite friends for a conversation with no end time.

Open your mind. Open the windows.

Plant a tree. Dream the future.

Enjoy the freedom of being present and now. Value what is within you.

Because your essence has something the whole world wants to feel.

That's what transforms.

May joy be shared. May relationships be cultivated.

May our home not just be the place where we live, but where we truly inhabit.

This is our wish.

Breton. Create. Live. Celebrate!

images.titleImage: Carbon negative for the third year
images.textImage: We are a pioneering brand in the segment to achieve the carbon negative seal three times consecutively. The certification recognizes companies that remove more carbon from the atmosphere than they emit, actively contributing to the preservation of the environment. A Breton legacy for future generations.

A pioneering circular economy initiative in the segment. Through an exclusive platform for reselling pre-owned Breton furniture, pieces in good condition get a chance to be part of new stories. Be part of this movement!

Combining artisanal care and high technology, the factory where our products are born was designed to mitigate environmental impacts as much as possible and minimize the waste of materials and raw materials that cannot be reused.

We are committed to recovering one of Brazil's most important biomes. Therefore, for every order placed at Breton, we plant a tree in the Atlantic Forest. The planting occurs through our partnership with the SOS Mata Atlântica Foundation.

section.text: VEJA TAMBÉM:
